elements.text: Just remove the first and the third equations.

text:
```@parameters t
function Pendulum(;name, g=9.81, L=1.)
    gval, Lval = g, L
    D = Differential(t)
    @variables x(t) y(t) T(t)
    @parameters g L
    eqs = [
        D(D(x)) ~ x * T
        D(D(y)) ~ y * T - g
        0 ~ x^2 + y^2 - (L^2)
    ]
    u0 = Dict([x => 1.0, D(x) => 0, 
                y => 0,  D(y) => 0, T => 0])

    p = Dict([g, L] .=> [gval, Lval])
    defaults = merge(u0, p)
    
    ODESystem(eqs, t, [x, D(x), y, D(y), T], [g, L], defaults=defaults, name=name)
end

@named sys = Pendulum(g=9.81, L=1)
pendulum_sys = structural_simplify(dae_index_lowering(sys))
prob = ODAEProblem(pendulum_sys, [], tspan)```
like this?

I'm not sure why I get
```julia> prob = ODAEProblem(pendulum_sys, [], tspan)
ERROR: ArgumentError: Any[Differential(t)(x(t)), Differential(t)(y(t))] are missing from the variable map.```
though. where am I failing to give D(x) D(y)
